review: The whole staff had made our Veteran's Day wonderful. We received a thank you card signed by all the staff, which was a thoughtful extra touch.  Our waitress, Becca, was so friendly, courteous, and attentive. Thank you!

We were ushered into the bar area; which is fine because there were no children in our party. We ordered food, it came out in a semi reasonable amount of time.  Their drinks are ok; I ordered a lemon drop martini it was a bit on the sweet side and I believe lemonade was used instead of lemon juice & powdered sugar. Lemonade is super sweet for me. I'm more on a tart kick than sweet.  Our food was correct and tasted fair. We will return to this location

I love Red Robin. This location has horrible service. I sat in the bar area so I saw interaction with kitchen staff as well as staff coming up to get drinks for the rest of the restaurant. Lots of comments were "I'm so glad that table left." They had a rush of phone orders and it didn't seem like anyone knew how to work the phone.  There were what looked like employees who were off the clock hanging out in the kitchen area not in uniform. There were also employees touching their hair and blotting makeup coming out of the kitchen area.  Specifically one employee had a negative attitude the whole time and make many negative comments about work and was demeaning to other employees. His name was Daniel.  On a positive note Britney was pleasant.  Hopefully management steps up their game at this location because what I saw tonight was far below par from what the rest of the company is producing.

I am highly impressed! I haven't been to RR in over 10 years because of the poor customer service. I decided to give it another shot and my goodness it was AMAZING!!!!!!!! The food was fresh the service was great. My waitress was Andrea and she was such a sweetheart very attentive and so sweet. She even came back with a drink to go truly nice. I am impressed I will visit this location again :)

Our family of four were seated very quickly and served by Hunter. She took our drink orders promptly and we ordered very quickly. Our family was super hangry and we were very surprised when our food came out in less than 10 minutes of ordering. Food and service were amazing and we are glad we stopped in. We were planning to go to the one at the mall (parking was horrendous) but it was worth the extra few minutes of driving to come to this location for the great service!

Server Rebecca (Becca on her name tag) was amazing ! There is no room for improvement for her! I've been coming to Red Robin for years and years and this is my home location. I've never had as good of service as we have this evening. She awesome ! Thank you so much for your time, help and wonderful service ! You truly are an asset to any company willing to have you.

This has always been one of my favorite places to get a turkey burger but yesterday I got one and got a terrible case of food poisoning. I'm still recovering. I had to miss school today because my stomach hurt so bad I couldn't get out of bed. Very disappointing.

Food was OK, however the service was sub-par, it took an extraordinary long time for our food to arrive, people that sat down after us got their food before we did, had to wave the waiter down for everything, they never came back to ask if we wanted more fires,   Maybe it was because we sat in the bar area, maybe not who knows,  Manager needs to work on the speed of service and or the kitchen staff and do some training to have customers checked on during the meal

Best Suited Occasion: Family, Friends, Kids Gluten Free: They have burgers that have gluten-free options. Experience: The waiter was extremely helpful. In fact, the people working there are helpful and friendly. But the food was cold and undercooked. Maybe it was just a rush, but for it not being too busy this isn't what we expected. Also, the fries were hard and cold, maybe due to the "bottomless fries" in which maybe this should be off the menu if they can't cook these items properly. Cleanliness factor there was gum on the table, the seats still had crumbs, and the restroom had a particular smell that is not too appealing. I do hope this is not too harsh only in the hope that as a business these features may change for the better.

Came here after 8pm since that's the time I'm usually off and to a pleasant surprise, it was happy hour!!! I was updated me that happy hour was new! I came in thinking it was about to close but I enjoyed myself and with no rush eating with my family whom wanted burgers and also waiting till I got off work.  Samira was great, she was all over the place...wasn't sure if she was the bartender, server, or manager but she was friendly, pleasant. Actually all the staff here is amazing because they're friendly and welcoming!!!
the servers here are so rude, the waiting time just to be seated is sooo long

I received an email from Red Robin if you ordered carry out, you would get 35% off your order. Of course I jumped on that deal. I went to the restaurant at the time they said my order would be ready. Tgere was a lady in front of me also waiting at the bar for her carry out. I want to say she had to wait like 10 minutes and she finally got her food. But they forgot her drinks, so then that took another couple minutes. It looked like they were really busy and weren't prepared for all the carryout orders. They brought out some food afterwards and left it on the counter. I wasnt sure if it was mine since more people came in and were waiting for their carryout as well. I waited for like 15 minutes and had to get a waitress' attention to ask if that order was mine and turns out it was mine. At no time did  anyone ever acknowledged me to say sorry for the wait. They also forgot about my drinks and I had to try to get someone's attention so I could get them. You would think I would of received something extra for the inconvenience or at least an apology....but nothing. When I got home, the burgers weren't hot and they forgot the jalapenos I paid extra for on my husband's cheeseburger.  I called and spoke to a manager and she apologized and said they weren't prepared for all the orders and offered to send a giftcard for the amount I spent. That was nice, but wished I had a better experience at this place and wished the staff there was more attentive to the customer. I haven't returned to this location because of that, but I have gone to the Riverside location and received excellent foid & customer service there. So I now go that location only.

We called in this Red Robin to place a pick-up order. A woman named Jolie answers and takes our order of 9 sandwiches and burgers. She then asks if we would like drinks. We reply "no thanks", and she literally said, "greeat, now I have to go sell 9 drinks to someone."  So it's obvious Red Robin has a drink-to-meal ratio they are graded on. Like a quota I guess. But this was the WORST interaction I've ever heard of from a restaurant employee. Why would you say that to a customer?? But wait, it gets better. To keep up with her quota, she put 9 waters on our order. See the picture below. We won't ever be back to this Red Robin again. Terrible.

The restaurant was not busy at all and had several tables open. There was a couple ahead of us who was waiting for a table and we were still told 5-10min wait. I'm not complaining about wait time it's the fact that with so many tables open we still had to wait? Anyhow, we decided to leave as we were worried service would be extremely slow based on what I read from reviewers.

Called to place an order to go and they automatically put me on hold. Drove over to the restaurant while I was still on hold and was told where to go to place a to go order. Was told they would be right with me. The person walked by three times and never acknowledged me or even tried to take my order. The funny thing is all I wanted was fries with a variety of dipping sauces. A very simple order! Never again! I know everyone has a bad day but what about team work and someone else stepping up to take my order?!
Jolie is the best bartender ever! I come here just for her! So sweet very professional!
Very slow service , worker are sitting back goofing off and talking about there plans for the weekend.

Went in there today my waitress was Andrea and she greeted me with a smile and offered me a drink right away. I love the customer service that she attended me with I will be coming back again as long as Andrea is my waitress always making sure if my food was okay and checking on my drinks. I highly recommend this place because of the customer service. We need more waitresses like Andrea!! Food was delicious...yumm

This place is awful. Slow, food isn't even hot when you get it and they skimp like crazy. My husband ordered heir bottomless root beer float and it was basically just root beer. When we spoke to a manager, she was argumentative. Every time with this place, bad service and mediocre food.

Sad to say I will no longer be going to this Red Robin no more. And it sux because I live 5 mins from this location and WAS a regular. Bad service, bad food. I ordered the Sir Acha tavern burger and I had absolutely no sauce. It was the driest burger I've ever eaten at red robin. I always get that burger and I know it was not made the way it's supposed to be. The waitress had a bad attitude, so I didn't even want to ask for more anything. Never ever going back.

Great service,great burger. A rare find in this part of town. Food is consistent. Staff is friendly. Feels comfortable. New veggie burger on point. I really feel any establishment takes a good team and boss. Great job. I really feel appreciated and waited on when there. It also makes you want to tip big.

I went to lunch with my friend here today and can say it was mediocre. The tavern which I ordered with onion straws and bacon was ok. The sweet potato fries were another story. They came out cold and unappealing. I think the food may have been previously ordered by someone else because after we ordered,our food came out in less than 10 minutes. I will not frequent Red Robin again. The quality of the food is dropping drastically. Better to go to Island's instead!

Personally I've always liked this location, the food is usually 4-5 stars in my book and the drinks are always made strong. As well, the staff is always friendly and checking how everything is. I always seem to go on off hours or days so I can speak as to what weekend evenings are like, but I've never had to wait long for service.  Also! They allow dogs on their patio which is nice :)

Saw a recent ad for their new Sriracha Burger and decided to check it out. This burger was an unexpected one way ticket on the underwhelming express. Served with Sriracha onion straws, spicy aioli, melted American cheese, tomato, lettuce, pickles and a side of disappointment.

Came here on a Monday night, and was pretty empty. Got sat right away and noticed out of nowhere this place got PACKED. Our server Dani was very attentive and always there to refill my water and continuously refilled my endless sweet potato fries.  And the manager Irish was walkin around constantly checking on customers, very friendly and nice atmosphere. ONLY con was it took a tad bit of time to get our food, solely based on the fact that they got busy all at once.

Thank you Red Robin for showing your true  patronage and supporting the veterans for Veterans Day yesterday!  Yesterday I took my family of 6 out for dinner and every penny helps, not only was it a free meal but it was the best meal that I have had in a long time.  Great customer service and great ambiance.  Thank you!

Best location out of them all. The good is always fresher at this location. The staff is always amazing too. Overall I have not yet had a visit I did not enjoy! Today we had the pleasure to go for my girls third birthday and it was a blast. Thank you Red Robin!

Talk about ridiculous! We go to take the kids for dinner, we go to sit in the bar. Now, not at the bar counter, at a table with the kids. In the state of California, as long as they are serving food, it's not the bar top, you can have children before a certain hour. We have had our kids in here dozens of time, this "manager" comes and says oh we don't let kids in here anymore.  Ummm, I call "bs!"  This is not illegal, learn your law idiot.  So we no longer eat at Red Robin. We went to Claim Jumper. We are seated in the bar eating with our kids and other families.
I had a black & blue burger there last night and I got food poisoning.  Red Robin served me a $14 burger that made me sick since last night!!!you still wanted to go there; it is your choice.

Food was good but bad service. Host had a hickie and waiter sat down taking my order... Leak in the roof. Scared tf out of me rn singing happy birthday . Didn't give us utensils till after we were half way done eating...

Our family absolutely loves this location. Management seems to have a heart for training and caring for the customer. That reflects on the way every employee treats guests. A very special mention to Hunter who's service has been a display of what excellence should be. Thank you Red Robin Corona for creating such a welcoming and warming environment. This review is way overdue. Cheers!

I took my lady to this place for an early dinner/ late lunch, and we had received great customer service. We sat at the bar, and was immediately helped by the bartender. I had ordered a type of BBQ burger and it was beautifully prepared and presented, paired with a Lagunitas IPA and I was set.  The only issue I have was that when using the rewards program, if you have a promotional item (for instance, a BOGO) there is no warning or heads up from the server. Though this might not be an issue for some, it was for me as my lady and I knew a family member with one and decided to have my meal count towards her account as we don't come here often. Looked at our check after we signed and completed the transaction to see the burger came off (meaning, instead of helping the family member, I took their reward from them).  Other than the reward issue, I still highly recommend this establishment for both a family outing or dinner date, nothing beats the tasteful gourmet burgers!

This has happened more than once at this location - You can be standing by the front podium waiting to be seated and not get anyone working to approach you. The servers in the restaurant and bar side see you and ignore you.

Ordered shrimp & fish combo plate, shrimp was over cooked and the fish was raw. Wife ordered one of the specialty burgers, we both agreed it had no flavor. The fries were old, as if they were made earlier and left to sit for hours. Paid extra for the garlic fries which had no garlic on them. Used our gift card for this, not worth the expense. Since we rarely go out for lunch this was a great disappointment. Gave two stars only because we liked the waitress.

Came in on a Tuesday afternoon with a table of 8. Our servers were very friendly and nice. They came by frequently to make sure everything was okay and managed to get everyone their food and attend to all our needs quickly and efficiently. Our food came out all at the same time and didn't take too long either.

Go to the bar, better and faster service, overall good burger joint. Great lunch. I wouldn't go here for dinner or breakfast. Great place for good drinks and deserts. Don't expect too much and you'll be good. Remember, it's just a burger joint.

This is the worse Red Robin I have ever been too.. I avoid this place... live right around the coroner and refuse to go here. Food is nasty and works just not that friendly.... I have lived in area for 10 years and have never had a good experience here and I inform everyone I know to avoid this location... something must be done or my vote is to close this location!!!!
So this trip so much better.  Greeted with a smile.  Siting at the bar waiting for my Togo order thank you.
We had a patty melt with bottle less fries.  It was delicious and our server was great, her name is Jolie.  We come anytime when I am in town.
What happened to this place? The management is horrible and so is the service and quality of food. I will never return to Red Robin again.

I always great awesome customer service when I come here! They make my alcoholic drinks just perfect seeing how I'm picky on how my drinks are made. The food is also delicious! I had the Marco Polo sandwich and my eyes were practically closed whenever I took a bite!! I could not believe how tasty it was. I would come back again!

They sat us, even with the kitchen closing in 5 minutes... Felt super bad but, they were more then willing to take us on! They brought out the food quickly, even gave us extra fries just cause :D Food tasted good. Loved it. Thanks for the great night! Sorry for coming in so late :(

I actually don't come here for the burgers... I go for their excellent wings which are fried very crisp and the dirt cheap happy hour well drinks.  The waffle fries they serve with the wings are also quite good. If you go at lunchtime, their double cheeseburger special is quite good and inexpensive with bottomless fries. It will remind you kind of like an In N Out burger.

Everything was perfect. Fast and friendly service with delicious food too. Our waitress was extremely attentive and we even got a visit from the manager asking how everything was. The bathrooms were also very clean.
I ordered my burger med.well, by the looks of it the chef decided to give me med. Rare ): NoBueno
Havent had red robin since high school and the food and service here is definitely great. Our server CLAIRE was the best!

My family and I love this place. The servers are awesome and are very attentive... This is one of several reasons why we return. The burgers are always yummy. I ordered the Tavern Double. It was made to perfection.

***UPDATE*** I've been contacted by management and nothing is being done. Like I said earlier, the people running this store don't have a clue. Go somewhere else. I'll never step foot inside again.  Beware of the old lady bartender Jolie, she is the most rude and pushy bartender I've ever met. She loves to brag about how she's been there for 24 years but she will give you a dirty look and ignore you if you order water. I can't believe management let's her walk around the place and behave so rudely. We asked if we could please get some fries before our meal. We were greeted with a "I'll see what I can do" from across the bar. This isn't the first encounter we've had with her being extremely disrespectful. I'll NEVER be visiting again because of her. Hopefully management wakes up and realizes in a competitive industry like restaurants, a rude and disrespectful employee can cost a lot. Go somewhere else where they care how the guests are treated. I'm extremely disappointed bc I like red robin, but this lady and her attitude are too much.

This was the first time my wife went to Red Robin and my first in probably 10 years since living on the East coast.   First impressions, the parking lot was completely packed so we parked behind the building over near the gas station.   But when we walked in wasn't crowded at all.   Ambiance and seating selection was good and we were greeted quickly at the door.  Hostess was super friendly and seated us right away.  Menu selection was good and prices were about average.  Bottomless fries was a definite go with us and we substituted a side salad on one meal and used the bottomless fries on another to split it across the table.  Food timeliness could have been better but the server made up for it with prompt service after it go there.  Overall a good experience from here and we will come back.

This review is based solely on the host, Donna.. as you walk in they have balloons already made for the kids. We told our son you can have one on the way out. Well we get back up there and I say oh no they're all gone. Donna was listening and looking right at us when I said this... you would think she'd say oh let me go get him one. NO! My grandmother asks, is there a way he can get a balloon. Donna says well all the stuff is in the back. My grandmother says well we will just take the stick and balloon and do it ourselves if that's ok.. Donna then says well all the stuff is in the back I'll just make him one... all bitchy.. she then brings it out and my son says thank you and she very bitchy says no problem... she definitely needs an attitude adjustment and some customer service skills!

If your going to go to a Red Robins, drive to the one on Tyler. Everything is better at that location! For one, the kids pizza was terrible and COLD! Their fries were also stale and COLD.  The kids meat ball platter had 5 tiny meatballs. And their bathroom smelled like someone died while pooping, and then popped themselves postmortem.... And they left of there rotting for a week.  Either they need more servers on the floor or they need a manager to stay on top of them because the service was very slow. They were nice though. The only reason I'm giving this a 2 star is because their burgers were very yummy. But the bad outweighed the good by far. Sorry!

Went inside today, asked if my party of 5 can be seated in a booth instead of a table and they basically said they couldn't accommodate us (there were 4 open booths).  How is this location even surviving!? They should close it down and open an ISLANDS instead. We took our business to...ISLANDS! They're just one more exit up off the 15 fwy. They gave us a booth with no problem, the food and service was excellent!
Terrible experience.  I was  the only one at the bar and the service still sucked !!!  And to make things worse, no NFL TICKET!!   Ugh

Been here a couple times and never received service the way we did tonight! Jay was amazing in every way and helped us out with anything we needed! If only customer service was always this way. Such a people person with a great personality. Workers who go above and beyond really deserve recognition. Thanks again Jay!

Great food for a burger, service is excellent  The staff is always prompt and nice! This place is very clean you will always catch someone doing some chores which makes you feel clean about sitting down and enjoying your meal. Very refreshing.

I had a great experience last Wednesday 8/24/16 with Blake as my server. He was so attentive and friendly and went above and beyond our expectations. Gave me a great drink recommendation, brought out fries right after we ordered to hold us over until our food arrived. Throughout our meal he refilled our water without having to be asked. Not once did I feel like I needed to search for him, because all our needs were met before we even "needed" anything. We will be back!
Early lunch with my daughter before getting my teeth drilled. We had an amazing server named Shawna. She was very attentive and on top of everything we needed. Highly satisfied with our visit today

So, i had an issue with this place before and never had a chance to update my review, so I'm doing it now. Their customer service was great! After a bad experience I had there with a friend i was contacted and given a free 25$ gift card to come and enjoy a nice dinner. It was much appreciated. Thanks guys :)

This was my first time ever going to Red Robin and it was absolutely amazing. The food was great, but what stood out was our server Daniel. He was phenomenal! I myself am a server at a restaurant and I am guilty for silently critiquing other servers when I go out. Daniel was everything I could ever ask for and more in a server. Polite, reliable, EXTREMELY personable, hard working and always on top of everything. My partner ordered one of the bottomless drinks and never once did he have to ask for a refill because Daniel always had one immediately on the table. He was also always busy doing something and not standing around. His suggestion for putting the cold sauce on the side of my hot burger instead of on it was so helpful. I'm completely hooked on this place because of Daniel so expect a regular!! :)

Been going to red robin for many years now not to this one but lately the food hasn't been like it was before I went on Tuesday had a burger it was flavorless my bun immediately crumbled & fell apart just ended up taking what was left of the bun off & barley ate the rest. The fries used to be one of the many best parts of this place but those also lack flavor & were soggy not crispy what's so ever even after I ask for them well done. Maybe it was just an off day but red robins needs to do better on their food .
I have always loved Red Robin's Bleu Ribbon Burger! Great atmosphere and service. Wide selection of food. I just wish the fries came out faster!
This was a 5 star experience. Had the cheeseburger which was outstanding.Endless fries and great service!

First time in this restaurant as we usually visit a different Red Robin. Our family Came in here on a Tuesday night for dinner. It was around 7:30pm and the restaurant was super slow. It was my husband and 3 kids. We ordered our drinks: Husband asked for a ice tea. Waiter never offered any kind of sweetener and by the time he walked by, my husband was in a bad mood to ask him for any. I ordered a lemon drop martini. It tasted more like lemonade and the rim of the glass didn't have any sugar like a real martini is suppose to.  The food came and it wasn't any better. My husband ordered a bar-b-q burger. It was missing the bar-b-q sauce. My chicken wrap looked more like a street taco than a wrap. My daughters fruit looked like it was soaked in water and our fries were hard and staled. Just gross.  Last but not least and the icing on the cake, there was a huge cockroach walking in the kitchen. We got sat in the back right by managers office and we had a view of the whole kitchen. As soon as we got sat down, I got an iffy feeling about this restaurant. Worse part is an employee was pointing it out to the female manager and she ignored her. It wasn't until I told her; you have a cockroach walking in your kitchen did she go back, but all she did was look at it. It wasn't until we also pointed out to our waiter and that's when he went over there and stepped on it. To be clear it was a water bug cockroach so when then waiter was trying to step on it, it started flying trying to get away. SO GROSS!!! Never ever ever coming back to this location!
Old and smells like sewer inside. Waitress did not even know the difference between 1/4 or 1/2 lb burgers meals. Service is bad. Would not eat here again.

The restaurant has a confusing entrance if it your first time there. We got seated quickly and our waiter attended to us right away. She was friendly and made sure our cups were not empty for long. For me their burger was ok not to bad not to good either my gf seemed to have liked it. I came here for the unlimited root beer floats so I cant really complain. I would probably be coming back for more floats :D

This place has great atmosphere, always sit in the bar area for quick service and cold beer. Endless fries are a great bargain. Burger selection is awesome and they are always cooked the way u want them, great place to dine

Huge props to our server, Ian! Great family night with service that was attentive, helpful, and enjoyable. The guy has such a great attitide, it was infectious.  Food was on point, which was pleasantly surprising, as we haven't been to RR in awhile. My "wedgie" burger was fantastic, and hubby's Mac Tavern looked delicious.  Not a fan of the kiosks at the tables (2 year old demanded "GAMES!" all night, we had to hide it.) But everything else was delightful.  Thank you!

My boyfriend and I have been regulars at this location for the past year and a half, the food is always great but we get the most hospitable service ever when Blake is our waiter. His personality and energy makes us feel so welcomed while his service is perfect every time! If you come here to eat, I hope you're lucky enough to have Blake as your waiter!
Love this place, the burgers are really good! Now they also offer the endless fries, so you can have as much as you want of their thick fries. Customer service is great every time!

We came in on Monday night and that was our first Red Robin's experience. The host greeted us nicely and we got seated quick. Our server was very hospitable and friendly. She offered us their many dipping sauces to try. The food came out quick and better than expected. The kids were just too happy with their food and the balloons.

Tonight was one of the worst experiences in a restaurant in a long time.  Where do I start that is tough.  The service was awful the waitress came back once and never did ask if there was something we needed.  Never got a refill on my water. The food my wife's wrap was fine.  But our french fries were raw and only luke warm.  I went with a simple burger wanting quality over quantity.  What I got tasted like anything but beef.  The quality was so bad I could not finish it. The wifes happy hour drink was s watered down she could not finish that.  It was good they had machines to pay at or we might still be waiting. The one star is for my wifes wrap.  We have been there before and expected better.  Yes we have been there before but in my world you dont get 3 strikes your out. Excuse me but I have to get something to get the horrible taste out of my mouth.

Jolie was our server when we dined in for lunch. She is a great example of what customer service should be like!  We ordered the royal burger, whiskey burger, sangria, coke, and onion tower. Today we were given 15% off bc we had our Royal Member.  We've dined at RR at multiple locations and had different levels of customer service. But this lady need to work at a high end restaurant where she deserves higher tips!  I hope that management sees that in her. Sometimes when you see a wave a good/crappy serves/employees... it reflects on their management. Note that!
Do not let your kids order the mac-n-cheese. It was more like a watery cheese soup (I posted a picture). Server said that was normal. Burgers were just ok but fries and service were good.

I was in Friday night having dinner with my wife the food and service was good until  waitress came back over with our check my wife and I were eating the bar area the waitress looked like she could have been working both the waitress and the bartender at the same time and told me that I look familiar that I always sit at the bar in front of my wife this is the first time I and my wife been in this was very unappropriate with the waitress said I called and talked to the manager Heather and wanted somebody in the head office to call me back and I still have not got a call so I am calling the corporate office in Colorado I want action taken I want this waitress fired

Definitely not as good as the one at the Galleria, but the food was good as always.  My problem with this location is the service, extremely slow and not very attentive to customers with allergies.  The waitress we had on this particular occasion was very abrupt and had a bit of attitude, not very pleasant nor attentive.  She became almost panicked when we mentioned there was an allergy order.  The manager did a great job of rectifying our concerns when my wife came in contact with a spice she was allergic to, he comped her portion of the meal, the waitress however, could've cared less. Again, not a terrible experience, but definitely not as enjoyable as the Red Robin at the Galleria or the Red Robin in Rancho Cucamonga

This is the 2nd time we've been to this Red Robin location and I'm not a fan. There were 3 empty booths in the bar area but they had not yet been cleaned so we waited at one of the tall tables for one to get cleaned. 3 different waitresses asked us if we wanted a menu and we said we wanted to sit at a booth and it still took forever for someone to clean one for us. The bar wasn't even busy.    My husband had the Royal Red Robin Hamburger with Chili Cheese Fries and it was pretty good. I had the clucks and fries and it was also good. We usually go to the Red Robin in Rancho. Their customer service there is always better as well as the cleanliness of the restaurant. We just stopped in here because we were in the area.

So like any restaurant, the one thing that messes up a meal is cold or over cooked food. Unfortunately this time, we experienced both. My grandmother's food came out cold but our waiter, Blake, took it back and the chef brought out a fresh hot plate for her so that was great. Later we found out that Blake even got it taken off the bill for us, which not everyone does so that was appreciated. My moms burger was well done but like super well done to the point the meat was pretty dry. Blake recommended the burger though which she enjoyed other than the over cooked meat. My wings weren't exactly saucy or crispy enough, but I ordered boneless wings and sometimes that can be a problem with those. I have to say that for an appetizer size, they sure gave a lot of food. Blake was excellent so we will be back to have him take care of us again.
It's been a few months since I've been here .. Thank God my favorite BarTender Jole is still here !  Try their milk shakes ... To die for hand made FRESH ! Delicious! Did I say fresh ?

Sam is awesome! We went here tonight and it wasn't really that busy. Fast service, Sam was super friendly and talkative (she was so sweet and complimented me on my wedding rings & eyelash extensions). Food came out super quick, tasty as always. Parking lot was a little tricky to navigate.. I felt like cars were coming from every direction, driving down the middle of the aisle.. just be careful and go slow

This use to be an awesome place to eat (pre-2010). The service was amazing and the burgers were 2nd to none. We would drive about 15 miles from home, 3 or 4 times a month just to come here for lunch or dinner.  Now fast forward 5 years. We stop in once in awhile, usually as a last resort. This place has really changed for the worst. The restaurant looks old and rundown, there doesn't appear to be any type of upkeep, bulbs at tables are blown out, service is terrible, and the food comes out so so so slow......sometimes dishes come out 5 minutes apart from each other. So I can expect to get my food just as my kids and/or wife are finishing their food.  You have to pretty much wave down a server just to get your drink refilled.  To make matters worst we stopped in today because we were in the mood for a burger and fries and we were told there would be a 25 minute wait because all areas were full. I then pointed out to the hostess an entire section of 6 open booths with enough seating 24 additional diners and she replied "we are not using that section". Really? Not using that section even though you have 10 people (that's not including the people that walked out the door when told about the 25-30 min wait) waiting 25-30 minutes to dine at your establishment?!?!?!?  This is most likely out last visit to Red Robbin......there's just too many other locations to dine to have to put up with this type of service or should I say "lack of". UPDATE: Hunter was our server and she provided great fast friendly service.
Gotta say Great customer service tonight from both our servers and Manager. Food was exactly what we wanted. Keep Up the Good serves guys, we sure will come back.

I ate at this Red Robin location today, I actually use to work at this location when I was much younger and I keep coming back because the food is great.. However, today I was somewhat disappointed because our server for whatever reason didn't to take a liking to me or my mother... her name is Jennifer Ha and when she greeted us everything seemed fine, however, never once did she check on us asks us if we needed or wanted any refills, she seemed overwhelmed but it was hardly busy... Now, l hate using the race card and I never do but I would say this is the first time I ever felt discriminated against of because of my ethnicity... there were Anglo Americans in front of our booth and in back of our booth and noticed that she was attentive to those tables, she'd asked  them if everything was good and if they needed refills. I don't know, maybe I'm just reading into things, nevertheless, I wonder if I said something that was wrong or maybe just caught her on the wrong day.. my experience was one of an uncomfortable and disappointing experience. Nevertheless, the food was exceptional and never fails to deliver!
I called in a to-go order for a gourmet cheeseburger. $15 burger and they literally gave me like 8 French fries. NOT OK!!! never going back to McKinley Red Robin.

This was my first visit to any Red Robin in about 15 years and I had high hopes.  Let me give you the rundown on the good and the bad.  First the good: 1.  Excellent and speedy service by Travis. 2.  Super yummy mini tower of donuts with chocolate and strawberry dipping sauce. 3.  O.K. burger and fries (with cheese dipping sauce @ $1.19 surcharge). 4.  Good strawberry margarita. The BAD: 1. NO utensils from either of 2 servers who were helping me. Man, this is Service 101. 2. Happy Hour margarita half the size of those Mega gulp cocktails served right next door at Applebees, and at a lesser cost.  WHY? 3.  Kitchen forgot to add my caramelized onions on my burger, which, at $13.45, was grossly overpriced for a chubby burger and fries.... . 4.  Like many male servers these days, mine kept calling me "BOSS" every 30 seconds, which annoys the Hell out of me and many customers, particularly those of us who are senior citizens. For some reason this BAD HABIT of  using these nameplates like Boss, Bro, Buddy, Dude, etc. has become the norm at 75% of all restaurants I go to.  WHY?  What happened to "Sir"....the only really viable greeting?  Have these servers been watching too many episodes of Diners, Drive-ins and Dives with the flippant Guy Fieri?  Where are the managers with the teaching of proper server etiquette across the country? In fact, where was the manager at all at this location, as I never saw one nor did one ever greet me at the table. 5. 3 of the 4 TVs in the bar area did not have the captions running, which makes them just about useless for the customers.  It was only after I mentioned it to my server that an attempt was made to correct it.  Just lazy workers and management who may have seen this situation for months or years and never bothered to take 5 minutes to correct the issue and play multiple choice with the remotes.

Brother had a basketball game and we decided to stop by and get some grub. The Greeter greeted us and Daniel escorted us the our seats right next to the Michigan St. Vs Duke game..he knew we were interested when we were trying to Watch the game from behind the bar..(Kudos for knowing your customer)! Travis was our waiter. I will say top notch performance. He was on point. Very friendly..talkative..humorous... There was a little miscommunication with a burger..but Travis was on point and fixed it real quick..very polite and friendly...very happy we came here..We do not come to Red Robins often... But with service this great, we may come back...oh yeah..and did I say Happy Hour All Day!!!woo hoo!!!!
Great food and OUTSTANDING service. Ian provides excellent customer service and is a shining example of how to represent your company. Thank you and we will be back!!
Loved the burger and the service time was very quick and simple and they made sure to follow my order to my preference which was great :D

Mostly yummy but the burgers are getting smaller and more expensive...much more expensive. The service was pretty great though. There are just so many more place available for a burger that's bigger and cheaper.

Decided to try this red robin as it would be my first time eating here and I had a gift card so why not. Ordered the teriyaki chicken burger, no teriyaki and add thousand island with a side salad with a house balsamic vinaigrette. requested a water with lemon to drink. Simple order.  Whelp, was brought an iced tea with lemon. I didn't want to be a stickler so I took it as it was, I figured since it wasn't a busy Sunday night, I could swing for a water in 15 minutes when she checks back on me. 30 minutes later, no food, waitress is walking around, joking around with some very loud and very drunk people in the corner, and serving drinks at the bar. 15 minutes later food arrives, but a different waitress brings the food. I ask her for a water with lemon , she obliges - never shows up. My waitress finally comes - with food in my mouth. I motion to her another iced tea. She says okay. I never saw either again till the check. Boy was I upset and dry mouthed.  I give this three stars because the food was good. The chicken breast was juicy and savory, well put together and was delicious. the salad - they need to refrigerate the tomatoes. you could tell they were sitting out and acquired a funky taste and smell.  I wont be returning to this Red Robin, but I will try another one in hopes of giving them a five star rating, including service. FIngers crossed.

Red Robbin, well theres not much to say about this place besides that its probably one of the best places to go out to if your looking for a gourmet burger with bottomless fries and drinks for around 15 bucks. Plus great appetizers and entres if your not in the mood for a burger.. Ive been here plenty of times and enjoy every dine in. The burgers are cooked to perfection however you prefer,well done, medium, or watever. Theres plenty of burger combinations to choose from wether it be spicy, bbq, or just an old classin cheeseburger, plus your create your own choice. I highly recommend getting the freckled lemonade as a drink if your not a soda drinker like me, the drink is sweet full of strawberry pieces and just thirst quenching. And if your into spicy get the Burnin Love burger. Its a good one.. Not much more to say. This place basicaly speaks for itself, but definitely deserves a great review.

I'm driving home from work stuck in the 91 freeway and I feel like I don't want to cook. So I call into Red Robin to order some food to go, and proceed to wait on hold for over 10 minutes as I drive to the restaurant. I'm actually still on hold on the phone by the time that I walk into the bar area to place my order. The guy behind the bar asked me if I'm here to pick up an order to go, and I tell him I would love to be picking up my order but I'm actually still on hold to place my order because no one has picked up the phone from being on hold.  He says "no problem, I can take you order right now, what do you want." I'm flabbergasted that he's not at all concerned that I've been on the phone holding, Who is in charge of this place? For some stupid reason I proceeded to place my order rather than just walking out then and going to Wendy's across the parking lot. Then right in front of me a girl proceeds to give the wrong food to a gentleman who ordered wings to go. This is when I heard something I didn't think I'd ever hear someone say to another person "oh, you're not my fish, you're my wings" I wanted to tell that girl her customer is neither fish nor wings... that's a person. This place is the Worst at ToGo Customer Service.  3 Stars because the food always tastes good (Amazing, Consistent Cooks) and she offered to refill my Coke before I left.
At 1 in the afternoon and only 3 tables full I expect service to be on point, everything took forever  I will never come back to this location the one on tyler is way better

Was there on Saturday and really enjoyed the fiery ghost burger again. This time the manager and kitchen manager checked on us if the food was the way we wanted it. Good staff. Keep up the great service and we will see you soon.

Remind me to not come here again. It's not the food it's the complete lack of organization and lack of service from every single employee here. Friendly but no sense of urgency or ability to multi task.
Like a broken record I keep trying to order a to go meal and we are currently 3-3 in the ordering to go and it being wrong.. Wrong burger, wrong side, wrong fries... Each time it's something..

Haven't been here in a while. My boys and I were pleasantly pleased with service and the gourmet burgers. Vanessa was nice and a very good server that kept are drinks full. 5 Stars for RR in Corona. Btw the burgers were awesome. Better than in n out, 5 guys and Slaters 50/50 put together. We will be back!

I used to frequent this location around 2005, and back then it was actually decent. However, we moved to Corona last year, and being the Red Robin lover that I am... we came to this location to eat twice. The first time wasn't great. Service was slow, unfriendly, and the food came out blah. This restaurant is never that full... so that can't be the issue. We gave them the benefit of the doubt and came back again another night. Service was EVEN WORSE. Food came out soooo slow (I am talking about 30-40 minutes after we ordered in a mostly EMPTY restaurant) and it was cold and bland. At that point we vowed never to return to this location. I happily drive an extra 10 minutes to go to the newer Red Robin at Tyler.  Perhaps management changed between 2005 and 2014.... but whatever happened... This location and staff should seriously reevaluate the way they run their business. Just terrible.

The service was good the environment is enjoyable. We ordered the DGB Burger and it is amazing. You must try it. We were celebrating your birthday so they came over and saying a birthday song. Yes I will come back to this place

I'm not the biggest fan of chain restaurants, usually I go for the stand alone businesses where I hope there's a bit more heart and soul in the food. However, on a recent drive back from Southern California to Vegas, we stopped in Corona for a bathroom break and gas.  It was dinner time and there weren't too many restaurants showing up on the Yelp app.  But a quick tip referring to "Free refills on root beer floats!" at Red Robin attracted my eye.  I called them up to confirm and it was very much true! We were seated in one of those smaller booths right when you walk in and immediately ordered the Root Beer Float "A mug of hand-drawn Bottomless soft serve with Bottomless Barq's® Root Beer." ($2.99)  Apparently, there are other drinks that are bottomless as well, not just the root beer floats.  The waitress quickly brought them over, along with an extra mug of root beer.  Yum! The Husband ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger "The Original upon which we have built our fame! Garnished with crisp lettuce, fresh tomatoes, pickles, onions and mayo. You choose your favorite cheese: Cheddar, American, Swiss, Bleu, Provolone or Pepper-Jack.  Make it truly Original -- add Red's pickle relish." ($8.79) When you see this burger, it's a real burger.  It's huge and loaded and has all the fixings that make it a real burger.  Plus, it comes with their bottomless steak cut fries, which I really dig as well.  (I also read a quick tip about having them put garlic and cheese on the fries.  We asked the waitress about it and yep, she brought over a basket of fries with garlic and parmesan cheese on it.  Nice!) I ordered the Classic Creamy Mac 'n' Cheese "This dish is the big cheese. Our take on classic mac 'n' cheese has swirly Cavatappi pasta tossed in a creamy four-cheese sauce, topped with more gooey cheese and baked to golden brown. Served with warm garlic focaccia bread and a side salad." ($8.99) Ultimately, I didn't eat my mac 'n' cheese, rather I finished up the salad and packed the rest to go.  I was busy working on my second round of Root Beer Floats!  Yep, when I completely finished my first, the waitress brought back another round for us both.  Sure, not the smartest choice to be consuming so much liquid while you're on a road trip, but it was darn good!  An interesting tidbit is that they include the nutritional value fact sheet right on your table!  So, you can get an idea of how many calories and fat your lunch or dinner is going to be, you may rethink most of your order! Overall, Red Robin is what it is.  If you love burgers, then you might really like this chain.  I like steak cut fries, and when they are endless, it works for me.  Bottomless root beer floats are always a plus too!  It's generally your all-American fare though.

TACKY! I have never in my life been walked into a restaurant and the hostess at the front desk hands you a tray with your silverware and napkins  on it and walks you to your table!  She put her hands all over the top of the silverware first though and it was dirty.  We asked for a replacement and the waiter walked it back over to the hostess to exchange it!    We spoke to the manager about it and she said it is their new policy.  SO RIDICULOUS! We also ordered clucks and fries and the waiter brought us fish and chips.   NOT IMPRESSED!

Not to happy with the managements decision not to let my kids in the bar seating area. The law states no people under 21 May be seated at the bar. These guys have taken it a step further and not allowed kids in the entire bar section. Places like Applebee's and other popular restaurants allow this. Just wanted impromptu seating with tv's in view. Perhaps I'm being over sensitive. Guess I will wait for a table, and attempt to order again without sports.

ZERO STARS would be far too generous of a rating. My husband and I stopped at this Red Robin after starving for hours and purposely waiting for a better place than McD's or Subway on our roadtrip from Phoenix, AZ.  Boy, was that the wrong decision. We both had burgers--my husband had the royal red robin and i had the burnin' hot burger. It doesn't even matter whether it was good--the most important thing is that we both got TERRIBLY ILL from food poisoning the next few days! It couldn't have been anything else, because it was the only meal we had that day.  Bad beef, anyone? Ugh....just thinking of all that time I spent making friends with the toilet...I will never go to a Red Robin ever again!
Every Red Robin I go to has the slowest service. No customers and 20 minutes to take our order and now 20 minutes and counting for our food.

I hadn't been to a Red Robin since I was about 7 years old but I went with my parents just to get something cheap for lunch that was just a step above fast food drive through - the reality is this is worse than drive through food and it costs almost twice as much. CONFUSING AND BULKY MENU: Almost 12 pages printed front and back with ads and promotions stuck in-between each page to make it even bigger. Even our waitress was confused because the menu missed details and placed items in the wrong sections, you could tell she was bothered by it and the fact that it's so massive and full of promotions instead of actual menu items - not to mention had to be turned like a book yet didn't have page numbers so you couldn't tell someone where something was. FROZEN, CANNED AND ROTTEN INGREDIENTS: The tea here is all made from syrup so it leaves you with a lingering, syrupy  aftertaste with each gulp (every other beverage has sodium/sugar). My mom likes sweet potato fries so she payed almost $2.00 extra to have those with her order instead of the regular fries. Her sweet potato fries initially looked good until we ate them and realized they weren't fried recently, they were just reheated and then they served them to her cold - my mom doesn't cook much but even she said she's had better frozen fries at home and that wasn't even her insulting the food, that was her being prideful of the fact that she can cook better than someone who is fully employed as a chef.  My fruit salad was basically half of an apple that had gash marks and dark brown blotches all over it like sticks had been jammed into the sides.The pineapple they claimed to be "fresh" had to be at least 5 days old as it was limp and soggy, it's not hard to tell when fruit is fresh if you eat it every day. The strawberries in my fruit salad were the same frozen strawberries they put in beverages so.. yes, that means they were pale, bloated and squishy. I didn't even try a bite of it after I saw the BROWN, WILTED mint leaves on top - you have the laziest chef ever! The main entree item I ordered was a turkey deli sandwich... Was I expecting something rotten and oily? No. You can tell when deli meat goes bad not only by the way it smells but by the way it tastes. It will have a liquidy coating to the meat which only brings out the pungent foul stench which is exactly what Red Robin's had. I gagged after two bites and had to stop - I am a big guy at 6'5 tall and I had an appetite before we got here but after I tried their food I lost my appetite and demanded a refund (which I got quickly because the waitress agreed that my food was gross - I didn't order anything else). If you are the owner of this franchise please sell this property and allow a better cafe to come in, this place is an embarrassment.
The service was slow.. Drinks came out than it was 40 minutes til our food came out. Burgers were ok I had the a1 peppercorn. Server was cool but food service was slow

I've only been here twice. Recently, I went to this Red Robin for dinner and it was pretty empty for a Thursday night. We were seated within 10 minutes and we had a waiter named Blake.  Blake was a really tall guy, so he had to squat down to take our order. He folded his arms together and leaned over our table which was pretty unorthodox to me. I felt a little awkward, but Blake was very interpersonal with his job. He took our order and our drinks came out promptly. About 10 minutes later, Blake comes and brings us a basket of fries and says "Here's something to start you guys off". I was really surprised and happy that he brought our fries as a sort of appetizer before our meal. I was really impressed.  The one thing I noticed about this Red Robin was that it actually had male waiters. Not to sound sexist, but I do prefer a male waiter, because of style of waiting. Blake took the initiative on a couple of things during our meal, such as bringing us a cup of water when our cups were almost empty, asking to bring dipping sauce when he saw that we were almost out, and etc.  The burgers were delicious and the fries were fresh. Blake made my meal very enjoyable and I would come here over the one in Tyler.

I left a so so three star review....then got a nice reply from Red Robin in response to my review. One major important thing to me is service and feeling valued as a customer.  I'm updating my review based on Red Robin's reply. I'll give Red Robin another chance as I really do want to LOVE Red Robin and I was shown by the reply that customers are valued. Some other businesses should pay attention to customer reviews and respond.

I came in Saturday evening to have a burger with my daughter. We are both super picky. Our server Samira was amazing and met all our dinner needs. She  was on point with fantastic service and all. She went above and beyond. She knew exactly what I would like and knew the menu very well. Food was brought to us  so we may build our own burger which was a brilliant idea.. I couldnt have asked for anything more.  She is a great asset! I hardly would ever go here, but after this superb experience, we will eat here a little more often.

This Red Robin has stood the test of time. Growing up in the area it was always a treat going to this location. Staff is friendly, food is always great, game room for the kids, and plenty of TV's to catch your favorite sports.

Love the food! Having said that, I must point out that the service is adequate at best, and the wait to get your food can be really long. Another thing I have noticed that is disappointing are the portion sizes. It seems that they shrink quite a bit.
Food is always on point at this location! And Blake our server was awesome! Highly recommend this Red Robbin location if you're in town! A+++++

So after a long day my family and I needed to eat. I remembered Red Robin and so we came here. Our server was Blake and he took care of us very kindly! The guy knows his stuff. He asked us if we wanted a surprise for a drink. What he brought me was a dangerous freaking good alcoholic drink. The food was amazing. I had the guacamole bacon and it filled me up. I definitely had a great time here. If anyone comes here ask for Blake, he will take care of you.

I have been going to this Red Robin since the day it opened 21 years ago. It has served as the meeting spot for many family gatherings, birthdays, dates, and memories. McKinley and Corona wouldn't be the same without this location. If you're looking for a great, family-oriented dinner spot, this particular Red Robin is your go-to location!

So the food is always fantastic (except the fried chicken sandwich, it's a stupid small filet, don't get it). We love this location because the service is always kind, prompt, and fantastic. You can see them putting their all in, even when it's busy. Will definitely continue going to this location.

One star only because there is no zero stars. This place is horrid. Dirty, bad management, kitchen has no clue, and to top it off ,service sucked!  Over an hour for chicken tortilla soup and a turkey crescent sandwich! By the time we got manger involved, she brought our food and the crease my roll was hard, like it had been sitting under the heat lamp for 45 minutes. No refills on or drinks. Not even a check in from our wateriest.  Manager, thinks she can fix things by comping our horrid meal and giving us a gift card. Which we will not be using at this location!  Also, the decor is so dated with all those lame ass pictures. Time to move on. Fix it or finish it.
Fish and chips were good the problem was that the waiter wanted to bullshit and kid around and I wanted to order. I brought a group of 7 and we wanted to eat.

WOW!  One of the worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant and it hit us like a ton of bricks at the end of our meal.  The waitress we had was great, very helpful and offered suggestions for drinks and menu items. When refills were needed she was on top of it and she checked on us just the right amount that wasn't annoying but wasn't neglectful either.  She pretty much rocked it and we were ready to hand out a worthy tip when we went to sign the credit card receipt to our surprise an $8.00 tip had already been added to our bill. When we brought it up to the staff one girl took off with our receipts and then never came back with an answer, then finally our waitress came back and asked us for our card again and took off again without saying anything.  She finally returned and thanked us for noticing the mistake...(her obvious attempt at ripping us off) and then took off again.  We will not be returning to this Red Robin and I suggest that anyone who goes there make sure to check your receipts so you don't get ripped off.

Our server Wesley was AWESOME!  We never had to ask for anything because he was attentive and hustled all over.  He had other tables and treated them just as good.  He personally explained to the cooks how I wanted my order and it came out perfect.  I love Red Robin but this was the best service and friendliest staff I have seen in a long time.  My first time at this location.

I frequent this place with my family and I always order the same thing: Bleu Ribbon burger - My all time favorite burger here. I don't even like onions but the straw onions that come in this burger compliment it so well. The blue cheese brings out the taste of the patty. All in all, it's a mouth-watering burger; it's delicious! Freckled lemonade - The refills kept coming and each time, they had strawberries in them. Most places they put strawberries in there for your first order,but for refills they don't. Fries - The steak fries with a little sprinkle of their seasoning dipped in their poppy seed honey mustard. yummmmmmmmm...... Red Robin doesn't disappoint!

Love the food!!! Very tasty and very juicy! No dry meat and the fries are so good!! The drinks are cheap and creative and strong with a kick. Service is excellent. Had a great experience. The red sangria is really good and so Is the screaming zombie!! The chicken blt was amazing!! The Klucks and fries basket was full of flavor and very juicy!! Great food and a great time alway to be had here!!

I don't know why this place has only 2.5 stars I just had the best service and a good meal to go with it and our server BLAKE was one of the BEST servers I've had in a long time I definitely recommend this place I came out here to hang out with a friend and I'm not from this area and I had better service then places I go to often

Blake is great! He is so buff and has a beautiful bum. He is on top of everything and I mean "everything"..that ass keeps us coming back for more..me and my husband would love for him to serve us privately

Horrible food, slow service no wonder it's empty on a Saturday night! I asked for sauce on the side. The put it on the prime rib sandwich that had 2 onions on it. Horrible! Goto in and out and save your money

Amazing staff great fresh food for a decent price I have been to this location several times no complaints. I love to go during happy hour for best prices. I highly recommend you get a red royalty rewards card if you plan on coming back. I have gotten free meals & appetizers cant beat free! My favorite burger is the Peppercorn burger. I have tried all of the burgers on the menu I still go back to the all mighty peppercorn!

Came to red Robin and the hostess Christina is horrible. She act if we are inconveniencing her and if we really want to eat here. I like eating at  Red Robin but I think one of the most important positions is the hostess that Welcomes you and sets the mood for the restaurant.

The food here is as good as any other Red Robin. I really like the burgers and that's the only reason why I come back. But the service here is TERRIBLE. I have lived in Corona and have been coming here for over four years and it's the same thing on every visit. Good food and EXTREMELY slow service.  Tonight we waited 20 minutes for the server to come over so we could order our food. It took almost 30 minutes after ordering to get our food. This was on a Wednesday evening. Our server was sitting at a table chatting with customers rather than doing his job. He forgot to bring out all of our food as well and gave us extra fries to try to make up for it. There is never a manager in sight. Does a manager even work here? Their "bottomless" fries are total BS too. You get 10-12 fries with your meal and if you want some more you must wait 10-15 minutes for the server to return and then another 20+ for him/her to bring you back some more fries. By the time they finally come I am begging for the check so I can get out of this place. I want to make it clear, I would never post a bad review like this based upon one bad visit to any restaurant. But this has pretty much been my experience every time I have come here (at least a couple of dozen times) over the past four years and I think they've definitely earned this review.
Ask for Blake ..... This guy is on top of it. Very good server, didn't have to ask for refills. Put the hockey game on the TV I asked. All in all very good service.
Been to this location a few times, only once did I have bad service. Still a chill place, good atmosphere and all sorts of diff burgers. Great happy hour

I had the lean chicken breast sandwich with bottomless fries. The chicken was great, and a large grilled breast. It was served open faced with pickles, tomatoes, lettuce. I added their BBQ sauce spiked with tabasco sauce. The bottomless steak fries were blah but much better with my spiked up BBQ sauce. The servers were really sweet even for such a busy Saturday night.

Food was delicious but the service was bad....waitress never took away our appetizers on table that has been empty the entire time during our meal & never took our empty glasses too. Table was full of empty & dirty plates entire time!

Customer service vs presentation? ????   Why is presentation more important than how I wanty meal prepared?    I asked for my Cobb Salad tossed.  Everywhere else this is a standard request.   Here I am told no.  They no longer toss salads due to presentation.   I really don't care what it looks like.  I wanted it tossed.   Tastes better.

If I could give negative stars I would. The service here sucks. We've been waiting over an hour for food. When it finally came the burgers were servery under cooked,  our empty glasses went unnoticed, when asking for sides(like a1 or ranch)  it never came. DON'T EAT HERE! SAVE YOUR TIME!! The only saving grace was the manager was extremely nice and actually cared.

This is my favorite place to eat the whiskey bbq chicken sandwich is the best. And bottomless french fries yummy. The service here is great never had any problems. But if you go on a Friday night b prepared to wait.

Reds Tavern Double, Fiery Ghost style! Mmmmm. Join the royalty club and get your free birthday burger. The shakes are delicious, get the big one so you get the extra shake. We always sit in the bar and the service is good and no kids allowed!

The worst service i have ever had. I sat there for over an hour i finally asked our waitress why everyone around us who got seated after was almost done eating and we still had no food .she said there was a problem my chicken. We did not order chicken. We got up and walked  over to Wendy's and had a burger at a fraction of the price. We will nevet go back to that dump

Visited here about a month ago and had the turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomatoe, avocado, sandwich.  Soooo good we decided to give it a try again.  Oh my word....terrible!  My husband and I always split due to portion control. My side had no avocado, one little tiny piece of turkey and a sliver of raw bacon.  Husbands side got turkey, a slice of avocado and a piece of raw bacon.  Endless fries?? I don't think so!  Served barely a scoop and when we finished and asked for a few more, our waiter acted like we asked him to make it himself.    Once again, restaurants need to educate their young people on wine. We asked for a glass of red wine and our waiter had no clue what the restaurant he was working for even served. We are done.  There are better places to go!

I normally love Red Robin, but this location is AWFUL. Slow & terrible service. Undercooked burgers, wrong orders, drink refills promised & not delivered. Ignored by manager with no compensation on bill. And it wasn't even busy. Will never come back.
The burgers are always fresh, the fries are not a crisp, my fave is those garlic fries. The wait sometimes is a little long, but it's also always packed when we are there. Staff is friendly.

Travis our server gets 5 stars as he was fast, friendly, and entertaining. The restaurant was clean and the manager and host were both really nice.  2 stars for the food.  The bbq chicken wrap was AWEFUL!  The fries were soggy and none of our food was up to Red Robin par.  What is going on with Red Robin.  You used to be the best, every time, any restaurant.  The chicken was horrible and tasted like processed chx and not grilled.  So disappointing.

We waited 45 minutes for a salad and a cold Cesar wrap. The chicken on the salad was cold and disgusting. The service was ok, but not once did the waiter come and tell us sorry for a long wait. I'm giving this location 2 stars because the Manager was able to give a 25% discount, but really that didn't help with my hungry party and a waste of my 45 minutes. Next time I'll go to the one off of Tyler in Riverside!

I've been to other locations before and generally was happy with my meal.  This location was bad. I got a guacamole bacon burger.  First they forgot to add bacon.  Avocado was limited and turning black. The burger itself tasted like a whopper.  I could have saved a lot of money going to Burger King instead.

Went to Red Robin for my son's 5th birthday family dinner.  They happened to be out of crayons for him but without telling us, an employee went to Wal-Mart and purchased crayons. Made his night.   Definitely looking out for their customers! ..... On a side note, the food was amazing!!!!

We were greeted and seated right away for a Friday night. Our waiter came and took our drink order and appetizer order. Mozzarella sticks came to us luke warm almost cold. Ten minutes later he took our order and another 35 mins came our food. The food was great but the wait was too long. The table was super sticky even after I cleaned them with wipe and napkins. Overall, food was great but service and wait time was horrible.

I came to dinner here with my grandma (who can tend to be quite picky with her meal options). I couldn't believe how accommodating they were! Incredible service all the way around, from the hostess to the server to the manager Tammy. Very friendly and helpful. The food was great as well.

I've eaten at many different Red Robins, but I've only been in the bar area a few times.  Today I stopped by around noon-time and went straight to the bar to have a beer a relax for an hour while waiting for my car to be detailed.  The bartender was friendly and quick to serve but didn't offer any specials or mention anything extra; seemed preoccupied by other "stuff", even though I was the only one at the bar. (???) I asked if they had beernuts or peanuts, and he answered short & sweet..."No".  I asked "Why Not?" and "Don't other customers ask for these items?", I also added, " Don't most "bars offer those things?".  The bartender said that I was the only one who had ever asked this question and that was it.  Man, he must have been having ONE of those days.  So much for good customer service huh?

Service- Sucked!!! waiter got my order wrong and never came for refills for water or fries. Burger- tasteless (should have gone to In&Out) Fries- blah nothing special Won't be coming back!!! IMPROVE your service and food!!

I have not been to Red Robin since I was a teen.  I was seated at a dirty table with a large chunk of avocado on the floor that I stepped on.  I got grossed out so we moved over to the next table another big mistake because it was literally almost inside the kitchen area that does not look in top shape.  Being the patient person I am we moved to our third table, weird thing no server had yet greeted us.  Our server came who turned out nice. I didn't have the heart to complain to her but I did share my initial experience with the manager when she stopped at our table to greet us.  Food quality and cleanliness were just not up to standards won't return ever again.

DELICIOUS, GREAT SERVICE. I highly recommend their whiskey BBQ Wrap...YUM!! And those endless steak fries are to die for, hard to to match anywhere else. Try their free different dipping sauces...they have several...I like the poppyseed one or BBQ ones. Also, usually no wait or hardly any wait :-D They could use more dinner specials though...

Horrible customer service. What's the point of calling in an order if I'm gonna have to order again once I get there. No one was friendly besides the host. Took forever to run my card while the dude was busy chit chatting. Get it together!

Best burgers around.  I get the whisky burger always.  I do order fries ahead of time since they do take time to come out but proper planning fixes that.  The kids love the mac n cheese.  Drinks are great for the price.

That's strike # 2 . The first time I walked . We ordered food and waited 45 min and walked out still had no food . This time we walked in went in walked to the bar we did see the sign it said " no kids at the bar but ok everywhere else ". So we went to sit at a table away from the bar . I asked the waitress if we could have this booth . She said no there's no kids allowed. I said why is that kid sitting over there then . She replied " ya he shouldn't be up here either . I took a deep breath and said ok thanks . Walked over and this old white hair lady clearly had her head up her ass 3 groups in front of us and she could not do jack squat with out checking every thing first and still couldn't figure shit out . Then we are all standing in line like you do at restaurants and the dumb shit says ok who's next . Everyone looked at each other like this lady is a dip shit . My wife looks at her and says well that lady's up front so she is . That lady gave my wife a dirty look from hell . I looked at the lady and said I'm out of here and she gave me the go fuck your self look . I believe in strike 3 but not until or if the management does something about there staff . Good food but don't treat the guy that tips very very well ask any place I review and also pays your bills . By the way I'm at Applebee's with a cold beer in my hand 4 mins after leaving the place . By the way check the Applebee's review I leave .

I had not been to a red robin in years, so when my daughter picked it as her birthday lunch I was delighted to go again. Our hostess was a young lady named hunter besides the fact that she was adorable she was very nice and quickly put my kids at ease (which is not easy there 2 & 3 and they do not take easily to strangers) our server was anthony, very nice and knowledgeable about the food :) he brought our drinks quickly and checked with us often so we didn't have to be looking for him. He was also nice enough to chance out a drink my husband didn't like and recommend another one that he loved :) we had a great time :)

Around 9:00 PM I walked in to this location but I wasn't alone. I had my 2-1/2 years old daughter with me. Place was not busy yet we were sat in the closed section. Chairs were up on the tables- bus boys moving and fixing tables and we were the ONLY people in that section.  Server handed me the menu and said, want something to drink? LoL nice relaxed greeting I must say!!  Anyway.....he had no clue type of wine they had by the glass or Cognac ...... I ordered two entree's. Remember one adult and one child under 3 years old.  He placed the sharp knife in front of my child......I took that away. And the hottest plate in front of her. Are you freaking kidding me?!?!  I moved both plates to the side and asked him to get me an empty plate for my daughter. He came back with a small bread and butter plate. LoL Hello, commonsense???? I didn't say anything but managed it without having to use that small little bread plate.  Right after I was served he dropped the check on my table. At least let me eat half way!! Well, he came to see if I dropped my credit card in it......I didn't because I wanted to order their chocolate dessert for my daughter. He came back twice to see if I paid............ he tried to clear my table as I was feeding my daughter....... I just had enough....... I asked, "dude, at least give her a chance to finish her food. Are you in hurry?" He knew what he was doing......didn't have an answer but said, "no, no-- I am sorry" and walked away.  A minute later a female server came to me and said, the other server's shift is over so I will be taking over." Music to my ears!!! lol   That young lady was wonderful.......offered coffee and dessert.  Funny because he was still there when we left--- lost $20 tip!! lol

First time ever going to Red Robin. It was okay. My husband and I wanted a good burger and figured this would be the best bet. It's a really neat looking restaurant and were greeted by friendly staff. Seated promptly and waiter was right over. Table didn't seem as clean as it should be. Kind of sticky. I asked for a drink menu and she handed it to me from another table, the menu was greasy and had cheese stuck to it. It kind of grossed me out. All the shakers and ketchup bottle on the table were also kind of dirty. These things should be cleaned nightly. Anyways...I had the Whiskey BBQ burger. Very good and fries were hot and fresh. Despite lack of cleanliness, the food was good. So 2 stars for the food.

SERIOUSLY, I wanted to go to Red Robin just because I  wanted some endless fries, So my boyfriend and I got and we wait at least 10 min till someone even ask's for our drink order, then abother 15-20 min to ask for our food order.... when it come out another 20 min later im pretty annoyed with the service. I used to love Red Robin but i wont be coming back to this location :(  boo on you.

I always get the Blue Burger. That thing is so damn good, it's unreal. Their fries with mustard, ketchup, and a brisk dusting of their seasonings. Oh nice boy! Uhhhhh! Had a 22oz Boo - light (budlight) @ HH for $4.50. Wish I wasn't driving,  cause I could of gotten wicked off better beer...as is dark beer. Oh well, it is what it is. Esss ok. Thanks for our Dinner Megan!

So I really love red robin I would always go to the one in riverside off of Tyler and it's absolutely amazing the service and the food...but I was really disappointed at this location the food is still amazing but the service here was just horrible, the server didn't ask if we needed anything after she brought out food there was no napkins we needed refills and I wanted some ranch she finally arrived within 10mins and still then she took her time to bring us that mind you it's not busy at all, by then we wanted more fries and yet another long wait it was just horrible the waiters name is Alissa btw and thank god she went on break because Travis took over and his service was amazing but sadly it was towards the end of our service. I'll just stick to the one off of Tyler
I've been there twice and both times have been fantastic!  The food and the service was very good!  I will most definitely be going back.

Love this place. It's clean, friendly and fast service. My daughters favorite place to eat. Everything I get here is good. I love their strawberry lemonade. Love their wraps and salads. Never disappointed when I come here. Another cool thing is they always open the door for you. Until next time. Thanks

Really enjoyed the food here .. It's pretty cheap for what you get .. I had a chicken sandwich with bottomless garlic fries which was amazing! Can't beat it! Only bad thing I could say about this place is that there isn't enough employee working on a Friday night! Other than that I would recommend to anyone.
Burgers were ok. Nothing special.  For the price you pay, you might as well go to In n Out or Five Guys that taste better and at a much lower price.

$15 blue cheese burger not worth it. Tastes like every other cheese burger. There was nothing special about it. Husband ordered prime rib sandwich with no horseradish. 20 minutes for food to come out and they still put horseradish on it. Still got charged for it. We came here, because it's been a while since we came here. Today's experience is a reminder of why it's been so long. Will I come back? Not for another 5-6 years.

I was a huge fan of red robin but the last two times we have gone have been horrible.    2 weeks ago.   We notice the menu and the plates have changed.   (Ok I have know problem with changes). Once we got our food,   Wife and I notice the quantity of the food was very small.   It was like a kids meal.   Six steak fries and a small wrap that was all tortilla Tonight, I order a crispy chicken tender salad.   What a joke!!!   It was the size of a side salad but still the same old price.
Wow great food friendly servers. I had a good time and had no compaints about the food here!
